English: An End to the Slave Trade
With the abolition of slavery in our country, so too will we block the world's slave trade.
Slavery is no more, for the good of our nation!
Mass Labour Outlawed
We've moved past our old barbaric ways once and for all.
Slave Trade Ended!
This is an outrage!
Newly Arrived Slaves
Get them to work.

Britain, the world's leader in enforcing the end of slavery, has caused us a bitter defeat. They have used their political force to demand that we end the practice of slavery in $COUNTRY$, and in our position, there is little that can be done.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has brought an end to slavery in their country thanks to British diplomacy!
Slavery Ended in $FROMCOUNTRY$!
Slavery Propaganda
To improve our grip on slavery, we must spread word amongst the people that slavery is good, and will lead to a better nation. So long as there is any doubt about slavery, this propaganda must go on.
Reinstate the Atlantic Slave Trade

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ strength is now enough to challenge the Great Powers of Europe, and now they can do little to stop our right to trade with the African continent. They denied our right, but now we can overturn the laws that banished the slave trade, and allow our country to flourish like never before.
Join the Atlantic Slave Trade

Now that the Atlantic Slave Trade has been established once more, we have the opportuniy to join it and reap the infamous profits of an age-old institution. Though it will anger the Great Powers, perhaps it shall lead to an alliance between these Atlantic slave states?
Leave the Atlantic Slave Trade
Though at once it seemed like a good and profitable idea, the Atlantic Slave Trade has only brought us ruin and infamy. It is time to end our participation in this damned trade.
Dismantle the Atlantic Slave Trade

The trading of slaves must stop. We once profited from the Atlantic Slave Trade, just as the nations of Europe did in their golden ages centuries ago, but the slave trade is not an institution for the modern age. We must bring an end to it once again, burying it in the pages of history.
Enslave Minorities
Thanks to changes in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ laws, we can now legally begin enlaving minority groups to better keep order, and manage the population for more profit.
Massacre Slaves
We have too many slaves, and we aren't about to free them anytime soon. A culling of the herd might be required to keep order amoungst our slaves.
Spread Pro-Slavery Propaganda

As time wears on, the institution of slavery continues to grow more and more unpopular. We will not stand for this! To improve our grip on slavery, we must spread word amongst the people that slavery is good, and will lead to a better nation. So long as there is any doubt about slavery, this propaganda must go on.
Enslave the Now Free

Some lucky slaves have earned their freedom, or were spared enslavement in the first place. Their freedom is at an end. We will seek them out and make them work, though it will lower our standing in the world and could spark rebellion amongst the people of $COUNTRY$.
The new government of $COUNTRY$ no longer support the abhorrent policies of it's predecessor.

The ships from Africa have arrived, and we've received more slaves for our nation! Although there are now less jobs for free men in the fields, new positions appear all over for transporting and utilizing the extra agricultural and mineral output. Some people are even finding their vocation as a slave whipper!

Without a leader, the Atlantic Slave Trade cannot continue. We have no choice but to end our trade, and focus on slavery within the bounds of our own country and neighbouring nations - or, should we have the power, we can lead the slave trade in place of the fools who dismantled it.

Once we may have made slavery the centrepiece of our country, but those times have passed. The time of mass labour and the slave trade is over, and we now sever all our attachments to those detestable pieces of our history.

With the dawn of the twentieth century, slavery in modern countries is fading away due to the prevalence of industry. A mere thirty years ago $COUNTRY_ADJ$ strength may have been founded on the backs of our slaves, but as tractors, automobiles, trains and other machines are making industry replace old mass labour, we have to make a distinct choice. Do we organize our slave economy, favouring it over industrial strength, or do we join the onward march of progress and free ourselves from the shackles that a slave society has forced us into? Just as fifty years ago a great house was divided, so now our $COUNTRY$ must become all one thing, or all the other: strong in the grip of slavery, or strong in the freedom of progress.
The Atlantic Slave Trade
We are taking part in the Atlantic Slave Trade, bringing us prosperity and a regular supply of slaves for our plantations.
Onward to Progress
The shackles of slavery have been torn off of our populace, and we are now adjusting to an industrialized economy. Surely we will be a global competitor soon.
Mass Labour
Slavery will never be obsolete! We have modernized the old system, working to create a slave economy for the industrial world.
Minority Enslavement
All non-accepted pops are being enslaved.
Forced Enslavement

Some lucky slaves have earned their freedom, or were spared enslavement in the first place. Their freedom is at an end. We will seek them out and make them work, though it will lower our standing in the world.
Slave Exermination Camps
Slaves are being killed here in great numbers

Inspired by the liberal revolutions in Europe, a party of Liberals in Brazil, calling themselves the Praieiros, has begun stirring up tensions in our country. They hope to bring an end to slavery, and also expand Brazilian voting rights, in order to make a more free country.
The Aberdeen Act
The British Parliament has signed the Aberdeen Act into law, giving them authority to seize and search Brazilian vessels for any slave traders, enforcing an end to the illegal slave trade.
Escaped Slaves
Escaped slaves have formed a Quilombo in this province, a settlement made up of ex-slaves in hard-to-reach places. It might be some time before we can root them out.

A foreigner has given a speech at a national university. Many were impressed by his eloquence and the intelligence in his arguments against slavery, saying that "in this glorious land, we celebrate the sight of a man in chains". He could become a major force in the cause of abolitionism, and already pro-slave politicians have demanded that his speeches be censored.
Progressive Society in $PROVINCENAME$

Capitalists have formed what they call a "Progressive Society" in $PROVINCENAME$, hoping to bring an end to slavery. Their reasoning is that slavery, as a rural, plantation-based economic model, has no place in a nation attempting to industrialize and compete in the modern economy.
$PROVINCENAME$ Slaves and Marx

In the plantation fields of $PROVINCENAME$, the sound of "The Internationale" can be heard more loudly and frequently than old slave songs. Many working slaves, having learned to read, have also learned about the philosophies of men like Karl Marx, and his vision of a world without social classes. What they intend should be obvious, considering their situation in our country.
Cheap Labour in $PROVINCENAME$!

Factories dot the landscape where once there used to be plantations and farms that ran on the blood and sweat of slaves. In this new $COUNTRY$, though, employers have begun hiring cheap workers because the cost of keeping slaves has become unsustainable for many. Arguments could be made against them that they are sabotaging the economy, but in a free economy, they have the right to employ whomever they choose.
Slave Tensions
Tensions between African-born slaves and mulatto slaves are making both groups less likely to revolt by preventing their unification against their slave masters.
Quilombos
There is a hideout of escaped slaves, Maroons, in this province, and they are causing trouble for local plantations.
Progressive Society
A group of enterprising capitalists have formed a Progressive Society in this province, in an attempt to discredit slavery.
Marxist Slaves
Slaves in this province have been reading and learning the ideas of Marx and other communist philosophers.
Local Workers
Factory owners and other employers in this province have been hiring local craftsmen, as they cost less than maintaining slaves.
Favour the Mulattos

There exists in Brazil a sharp tension between Brazilian-born blacks and mulattos, and the African slaves taken from overseas. By favouring the mulattos and granting some of them manumission in direct opposition to the Africans, we can appease Brazilian-born slaves while sparking tensions between them and the African slaves, reducing the chances that they will rebel against us.
Slaves/Forced Labourers
Chattel Slavery
Forced Labor
Chattel Slavery is allowed. People are bought and sold as if they were objects, as they have been since time immemorial. The children of the enslaved will be slaves themselves.
Freedom of Womb
Freedom of Womb Law
Slaves and Forced Labourer's children are born free and, in most cases, old slaves are also freed. 				  The slave/forced labourer population stops growing from births.
Freedom of Womb Campaign
Outlawed
Slavery and Forced Labor is forbidden.
Outlaw Slavery and Forced Labor
Compulsory Labor

It might be a good idea to use begin a program of forced labor amongst the most disloyal elements within $COUNTRY_ADJ$ society, this will keep them marginalized and unable to mount an effect resistance towards us.
Compulsory Labor
Enemies of our people are being rounded up and put to work.
Debt Slavery
If someone cannot afford to pay their debts, they always have the option to sell themselves into slavery to pay here.
Debt Slavery

Many debts have been going unpaid because the indebted have no assests to cover their debts. We can start a policy of debt slavery were the indebted can sell themselves in exchange for clearing their family debts..
Slaves Traded
Slaves have been traded recently
